title: 107_hr1262
content: The "Federal Wage Worker Pay Fairness Act of 2001" defines boundaries of local wage areas for prevailing rate employees to align with pay localities under section 5304(f) with exceptions as deemed necessary by the Office of Personnel Management and the Federal Salary Council. The Act also designates the Office of Personnel Management as the agency responsible for conducting wage rate surveys. SEC. 3. AGENCY RESPONSIBLE FOR CONDUCTING WAGE RATE SURVEYS. Wage surveys under this section shall be conducted by the same agency responsible for surveys of pay localities. The lead agency for a local wage area shall analyze data and establish appropriate wage schedules and rates. SEC. 4. ANNUAL MINIMUM ADJUSTMENT. The amendment to section 5343 of title 5, United States Code, adjusts rates of pay for regular and special wage schedules annually based on the overall average percentage adjustment for General Schedule positions within the corresponding pay locality. This adjustment takes effect on the first day of the first applicable pay period beginning on or after January 1 each year. The Federal Wage Worker Pay Fairness Act of 2001 prevents new laws from superseding, repealing, or modifying wage adjustments based on surveys. Technical amendments are made to sections 5343 and 5348 of title 5, United States Code. The Federal Wage Worker Pay Fairness Act of 2001 prohibits new laws from overriding wage adjustments based on surveys, with a provision stating that no new law can modify this section unless expressly stated. SEC. 5. RESTORATION OF ``MONRONEY AMENDMENT'' PROTECTIONS. In section 5343(d) of title 5, United States Code, agencies must establish wage schedules for prevailing rate employees based on local private industry rates and rates for comparable positions in the nearest similar wage area. The wage survey process in section 5343(d) of title 5, United States Code, is updated to specify the agency responsible for conducting the survey. SEC. 6 amends the definition of 'pay locality' in title 5, United States Code. SEC. 7 outlines the conversion rules for adjusting pay rates for employees. SEC. 8 specifies the effective date of the Act. The Act and its amendments will take effect on October 1, 2001, with reporting requirements for the Federal Prevailing Rate Advisory Committee to submit reports to Congress within specified timeframes.
